item.source: New Media to celebrate CHUCKS RETURN!

item.title: New Media to celebrate CHUCKS RETURN!
item.dc:creator: Omega_Absolute
item.description:
:facepalm::facepalm::facepalm:

PlayerHater:

I have never ever said my grammar is perfect. It isn’t. Nor is my punctuation. But I do my best. Sure, I could be halfway excused because English isn’t even close to a mother tongue to me, but I’ve never used that as an argument. Having said that I don’t see any mistakes in my previous post.

Then why open your mouth at all?

Oh and another thing:
You forgot using single quotation ruling and [sic] ruling if you want to be even more technical about things. Let it go.

Read full topic
item.source: New Media to celebrate CHUCKS RETURN!

item.title: New Media to celebrate CHUCKS RETURN!
item.dc:creator: PlayerHater
item.description:
Omega_Absolute:

Hypocrite much? If you take the time to attack someone for their grammar, make sure your proof read your own argument. Simple as that. Welcome to the Black Mesa forums.
:facepalm::facepalm::facepalm::facepalm::facepalm::facepalm::facepalm:

:facepalm:

I have never ever said my grammar is perfect. It isn’t. Nor is my punctuation. But I do my best. Sure, I could be halfway excused because English isn’t even close to a mother tongue to me, but I’ve never used that as an argument. Having said that I don’t see any mistakes in my previous post.

Oh, and another thing:

Correct: Arthur said, “The situation is deplorable and unacceptable.”

(The period is known to be in the source.)

Correct: Arthur said that the situation was “deplorable”.

(The period is either known not to be in the source, its presence in the source is uncertain, or its coverage within the quotation is considered unnecessary.)

Choke on that.

Read full topic

:facepalm:

item.title: New Media to celebrate CHUCKS RETURN!

item.description:

Here’s your link

So, you’re basically admitting of being lazy and ignorant. Very good!
The facepalm is no comeback (as you may or may not know) and it also shows your complete lack of intelligent arguments.

This still doesn’t change the fact that the thread’s name has a grammar mistake in it.

item.title: New Media to celebrate CHUCKS RETURN!
item.dc:creator: Omega_Absolute
item.description:
PlayerHater:

You could’ve at least linked the original text. Doing what you’re currently doing I can easily invalidate your argument using a quote that I’ve written myself.

Or you could look it up yourself.
Here’s your link

PlayerHater:

This is what my logic on the quotation marks and period problem sounds like:
I’m quoting the desired text with my correction. No period inside the original, ergo no period inside my quote. And the period after the quote is a logical end to the sentence which the quote belongs to. Last I heard, sentences ended with mostly with periods.

:facepalm:

Read full topic

EDIT:
Nope I’m right.

You could’ve at least linked the original text. Doing what you’re currently doing I can easily invalidate your argument using a quote that I’ve written myself.

This is what my logic on the quotation marks and period problem sounds like:
I’m quoting the desired text with my correction. No period inside the original, ergo no period inside my quote. And the period after the quote is a logical end to the sentence which the quote belongs to. Last I heard, sentences ended with mostly with periods.

item.title: New Media to celebrate CHUCKS RETURN!
item.dc:creator: Omega_Absolute
item.description:
Damn you, now I have to look it up…

EDIT:
Nope I’m right.

Periods and commas always go inside quotation marks, even inside single quotes.

item.title: New Media to celebrate CHUCKS RETURN!
item.dc:creator: rorriMAesU
item.description:
IIRC, the quotation make belongs to the right of punctuation when quoting speech. If you are quoting single terms or entities (not speech), the quotation belongs to the left of punctuation.

I think hes correct, but Im no english major. It may depend on which style, british or american.

Read full topic
